itemDescription: London West India merchant and Governor of the Bank of England

wikipedia_page.main: Sheffield Neave (1799–1868) was an English merchant and Governor of the Bank of England from 1857 to 1859.

response: Airey Middleton Sheffield Neave,  (; 23 January 1916 – 30 March 1979) was a British soldier, lawyer and Member of Parliament (MP) from 1953 until his assassination in 1979.

Neave was the son of Sheffield Airey Neave CMG, OBE (1879–1961), an entomologist, who lived at Ingatestone, Essex, and his wife Dorothy (d. 1943), the daughter of Arthur Thomson Middleton. His father was the grandson of Sheffield Neave, the third son of Sir Thomas Neave, 2nd Baronet (see Neave baronets).
* Parliamentary Archives, Papers of Airey Middleton Sheffield Neave (1916-1979)

link_mentions.page: Governor of the Bank of England

response: Sheffield Airey Neave CMG OBE  (20 April 1879 – 31 December 1961) was a British naturalist and entomologist. Neave was the grandson of Sheffield Neave, a governor of the Bank of England and he was the father of Airey Neave.
* Sheffield Neave (1799–1868), English merchant and Governor of the Bank of England
